summary: Completed comprehensive testing of User/Date Report and Daily Work Limit Warning System. All 35 backend API tests passed (100%). Frontend components (UserDateReport, DailyLimitWarning) are fully functional with period selector, date grouping, user rows with subtotals, and proper data-testid attributes.
passed_tests: Backend: GET /api/fulfillment/reports/hours-by-user-date?period=day - returns hours grouped by user and date (200)
Backend: GET /api/fulfillment/reports/hours-by-user-date?period=week - returns weekly report (200)
Backend: GET /api/fulfillment/reports/hours-by-user-date?period=month - returns monthly report (200)
Backend: GET /api/fulfillment/user/daily-hours-check - returns user's daily hours with limit check (200)
Backend: POST /api/fulfillment/user/acknowledge-limit-exceeded?continue_working=true - records continue choice (200)
Backend: POST /api/fulfillment/user/acknowledge-limit-exceeded?continue_working=false - records logout choice (200)
Backend: GET /api/fulfillment/user/check-limit-acknowledged - checks if user acknowledged today (200)
Backend: All endpoints return 401 for unauthenticated requests
Backend: Daily limit is correctly set to 9 hours
Backend: Response includes daily_limit_hours field
Backend: exceeds_limit flag correctly calculated based on total_hours > 9
Backend: remaining_hours correctly calculated
Frontend: UserDateReport component renders with data-testid='user-date-report'
Frontend: Period selector (Today/This Week/This Month) works correctly
Frontend: Date grouping shows formatted date with user count badge
Frontend: User rows display Hours, Cost, Orders, Items columns
Frontend: Subtotal row shows totals for each date
Frontend: DailyLimitWarning component has proper data-testid attributes
Frontend: Dialog hideCloseButton prop now supported
Frontend: All 21 existing fulfillment timer tests still pass
critical_code_review_comments: Fixed: DialogContent component now supports hideCloseButton prop for DailyLimitWarning modal
Added: data-testid attributes to UserDateReport and DailyLimitWarning components for better testability
Note: useEffect dependency warning in DailyLimitWarning.jsx is intentional (checkDailyHours should only run on mount)
seed_data_creation: Used existing test user from previous iteration
context_for_next_testing_agent: User/Date Report and Daily Limit Warning features are fully functional. Test user session 'test_fulfillment_session_1769931244846' is valid. All 4 new endpoints work correctly: hours-by-user-date (with day/week/month periods), daily-hours-check, acknowledge-limit-exceeded, check-limit-acknowledged. The DailyLimitWarning modal will only appear when user exceeds 9 hours of work. The modal has a 15-minute auto-logout countdown. DialogContent now supports hideCloseButton prop.
